item.title: #en @ 1446496914892070929
item.description: Pssst, if you're still here: we just put up a new blogpost (in German): @gesch16 wrote a really helpful piece about the potential of #research data management and #opendata with great examples. Full announcement on Monday but you can take a look now! #RDM https://t.co/uKgudlbhDR https://t.co/sAvQYLQk1F

item.title: #nl @ 1446495533179281414
item.description: Open Data inspireert om andere onderzoekers hun data en protocols ook open te maken. Onze phd student @DFilioglou & Safoora Kamjan zijn pioniers in dit voor de gebieden waar ze werken. Ik ben zeker dat we zullen straks meer #opendata krijgen ook van andere onderzoekers

item.title: #en @ 1446478129439158273
item.description:
Congrats to @shellyrauvola for this awesome work!üéâ
This paper has it all:
- Theoretical integration and empirical demonstration! - Preregistered hypotheses/methods! - Open data/code! - Cross-validation in a holdout sample! - Results that question long-held assumptions! https://t.co/atEffEGvb2

item.title: #en @ 1446477719445938183
item.description: The lack of open, official energy data makes it harder to solve the climate crisis. It's good to see our friends at @OurWorldInData are on the case. See https://t.co/sorj3MxLMn for more info and how you can help https://t.co/I6g8JKeqRs

item.description: .@Twitter just launched prompts intended to remind users there's a human being on the other end of abusive comments. It's a good move, but just one part of the puzzle. We also need evidence and open data about how well such interventions work. A thread.

item.title: #en @ 1446074929850503173
item.description:
#Copernicus #OpenData is a unique source of information to help protect the environment in indigenous territories and the rights of indigenous people
94% of the population of Milingimbi Island, off the coast of Australia's Northern Territory, is indigenous

item.title: #en @ 1445872688547840000
item.description: "Addressing problems of colonialism will ultimately not entail whether open data practices are implicitly and universally decolonial, but whether Indigenous peoples have shared governance over the afterlives of data generated about and affecting them."

item.title: #en @ 1445872539159252994
item.description: "At stake here is ensuring that Indigenous peoples have control over and benefit from information generated from their communities, otherwise open data practices act as just another form of colonial dispossession."
